newsitem.title: USA: Vermont Senate to weigh electricity restructuring.
newsitem.headline: Vermont Senate to weigh electricity restructuring.

text.p: The Vermont Senate, whose leaders had planned to debate a bill to restructure the electricity industry earlier this week, now hope to get it to the floor on Wednesday.

But some issues are still unresolved, including how to pay for utilities' "stranded" costs. That's as much as $1 billion in costs for power contracts signed in a regulated market that will not be cost effective in the coming age of competition.

Leading proposals to deal with those costs include a 50-50 split between utilities and ratepayers, or a tax on utility bills. The bill also includes proposals for consumer and environmental protection in a competitive electric market.
